solution.text:
Volume of the brick wall \(= _{j}_ m \times _{k}_ m \times 0.5 m = _{{j*k*Decimal('0.5')}}_ m^3\)
Volume of one brick \(= 20 cm \times 10 cm \times 5 cm = 1000 cm^3\)
\(1 m^3 = 1000000 cm^3\)
Therefore, number of bricks required \(= _{{j*k*Decimal('0.5')}}_ \times \frac{1000000}{1000}\)
\(= _{{j*k*Decimal('0.5')*1000}}_\)

content.text: Anjali is building a brick wall which is _{j}_ m long, _{k}_m tall and 50cm wide. Each brick is 20cm long, 10 cm wide and 5 cm tall. How many bricks will Anjali need to buy?
